intro: Coelopleurum saxatile, commonly known as the saxatile coelopleurum, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically hairy and adapted to rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in certain regions.
